intro: Lagenophora gibbsiae, commonly known as the Gibbs' lagenophora, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in rocky or disturbed soils at high altitudes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
